summary:
Wrocław is a large city in southwestern Poland, known for its rich history and cultural significance. It has been part of many countries over the centuries, including Poland, Bohemia, and Germany. Today, it is a vibrant university city with over 130,000 students. The University of Wrocław has a great reputation and has produced many Nobel Prize winners.

The city boasts beautiful landmarks like the Main Market Square and Centennial Hall, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Wrocław also has a famous zoo, the oldest in Poland. It is recognized globally and has hosted various international events, including the European Football Championship and the European Capital of Culture.
title: Wrocław
